page.title: 18Fishing in Inchnadamph
page.content: {Inchnadamph is mainly a fishing hotel. 56_70%{of the guests are fishermen {(approx}500{a year).}Salmon, char{and trout{are caught. The}rare Gillaroo trout (with gizzard for digesting molluscs){is caught in one loch .In {Loch Assynt,there are}Ferox (cannibal) trout. July_August{is the busiest time {of the year. The season opens on}15th of March,{but at that time it is {very cold and not many fish are {caught. They start biting about May to {the middle of July, August is dour and {comes back on in September. The season {closes in October.Roughly}20 lochs{the {Hotel fishs. The biggest}trout{caught {was}12\ lb,{from loch}Assynt.{The {biggest}salmon {caught was }35\{lb on {the river Loanan.}600_700{fish are {caught approx. in a year.For bait, {flies(wet and dry), spinners and {dapping flies are permitted. }
